abstract.text: The Orange theme overrides some tokens from the basic
and should be seen as the default theme for the OUDS library with the Orange brand colors for example.

inlineContent.text: This is the default theme any Orange branded app should use, and can be subclassed to define for example themes dedicated to countries.
It embeds also in its target the brand colors which are not shared nor exposed in lower level targets or outside any module not depending to it.
kit and brings the Orange brand colors and assets.
It contains also colors dedicated to charts.
without further modifications, you will have to use the
for your root view and give it an instance of
. Keep in mind the themes are
and can be heavy, so you may use only as instance as singleton and not store any properties.
Then, in your views, you can simply use the theme through an environment variable to get the tokens:

code: import OUDS // To get the theme environment variable
// Get OUDS environment variable for theme thanks to themeable view
// Use the theme to retrieve the tokens

inlineContent.text: by subclassing it or by overriding some tokens.
Only the Orange theme can be subclassed today. If this theme does not fill your need you can also implement your own theme from scratch.
Because theme definition is based on thousands of tokens, you should contact the design team to get helped.

content.text: By using your own theme and subclassing existing token providers

inlineContent.text: You may want to define your own theme, thus you can override the
with your own class or just override the providers.
You will have to consider the semantic tokens providers you need:
colors tokens are all defined in
The color semantic tokens of charts are not overridable as they are highly related to the brand. However it can change in the future.
You can also override the component tokens providers you need.
to know which one you need to update.

code: import OUDSTokensComponent // To use component tokens if needed
import OUDSTokensSemantic // To use semantic tokens if needed
import OUDSTokensRaw // To use raw tokens if needed
// MARK: - And also for components tokens
override public var buttonSizeMaxHeightIconOnly: SizeSemanticToken { DimensionRawTokens.dimension600 }
override public var buttonBorderWidthDefault: BorderWidthSemanticToken { borders.borderWidthThicker }
override public var buttonBorderRadius: BorderRadiusSemanticToken { borders.borderRadiusMedium }
override public var buttonColorBgDefaultPressedMono: MultipleColorSemanticTokens { colors.colorRepositoryOpacityBlackHigher }
override public var buttonSpacePaddingBlock: SpaceSemanticToken { spaces.spacePaddingInlineSpacious }

inlineContent.text: You can instead of overriding existing semantic tokens provider implement your own provider but it will imply to implement maybe hundreds of tokens. Your own provider must match the suitable signature.
Then define your own theme class and assign the providers you want to override. If some are missing, default implementation will be used.

content.text: By overriding only existing tokens providers

inlineContent.text: Quite simple and similar to the previous solution, but give only the providers to the
But we recommend to define your own theme for clarity reasons.
